title: PR Analysis Workflow
description: Learn how to analyze pull requests for quality, risks, and test coverage using QitOps Agent.

steps.title: Introduction to PR Analysis
steps.content: QitOps Agent can analyze pull requests to identify potential issues, assess test coverage, and provide recommendations.

steps.title: Setting Up GitHub Integration
steps.content: Before analyzing pull requests, you need to set up GitHub integration. This allows QitOps to access your GitHub repositories.
steps.expected_action: Set up GitHub integration using your GitHub token

steps.title: Basic PR Analysis
steps.content: Let's start with basic PR analysis. The pr-analyze command requires a PR number.
steps.expected_action: Try analyzing a pull request using the example command

steps.title: Using Sources
steps.content: You can specify sources to use for PR analysis using the --sources option. Sources provide additional context for analysis.
steps.expected_action: Try analyzing a pull request with specific sources

steps.title: Using Personas
steps.content: You can specify personas to use for PR analysis using the --personas option. Personas provide different perspectives on analysis.
steps.expected_action: Try analyzing a pull request with a specific persona

steps.title: Reviewing Analysis Results
steps.content: After analyzing a pull request, review the results to identify potential issues and areas for improvement. The analysis includes code quality, test coverage, and potential risks.

steps.title: Taking Action
steps.content: Based on the analysis results, take appropriate action to address any issues or concerns. This may include adding tests, refactoring code, or requesting changes from the PR author.

steps.title: Congratulations!
steps.content: You've completed the PR analysis workflow tutorial! You now know how to analyze pull requests for quality, risks, and test coverage using QitOps Agent.
